alphabetsoup.base
Class BucketbotBase

java.lang.Object
  alphabetsoup.framework.Circle
      alphabetsoup.base.BucketbotBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
Bucketbot, Updateable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BucketbotDriver, BucketbotExample
public class BucketbotBase
extends Circle
implements Bucketbot, Updateable

BucketbotBase provides the basic functionality for a passive bucketbot. It contains all of the mechanisms to interact with other entities, as well as the basic physics, but does not have logic to control them. BucketbotBase should be extended to include logic.

Author:
Chris Hazard

Nested Class Summary
static interface BucketbotBase.BucketbotState
          BucketbotState is interface which should be inherited to provied states for the Bucketbot to be in.

pickupBucket

public final boolean pickupBucket(Bucket b)
Description copied from interface: Bucketbot
If Bucketbot is within range of picking up the Bucket, it will do so, return true, and incur any corresponding timeout. If the Bucket is out of range, it will return false.

Specified by:
pickupBucket in interface Bucketbot
Parameters:

Returns:
true if Bucket was successfully picked up

setTargetSpeed

public void setTargetSpeed(float new_speed)
Sets the target speed. Also sets accelerateUntil to be the time when the Bucketbot will finish accelerating and will reach new_speed.

Parameters:
new_speed - target speed value in [0,maxVelocity]

setTargetVelocity

public void setTargetVelocity(float x_velocity,
                              float y_velocity)
Sets the target velocity (and updates the target direction). Also sets accelerateUntil to be the time when the Bucketbot will finish accelerating and will reach the specified velocity.

Parameters:
x_velocity - desired x component of the velocity
y_velocity - desired y component of the velocity

getTotalTimes

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> getTotalTimes()
Specified by:
getTotalTimes in interface Bucketbot
Returns:
Returns a HashMap with keys being the names of each state or task the Bucketbot has been in, and the values being the percentage total of time spent in each state or task. Note that the Bucketbot can be in two states at the same time (such as a low-level state and high-level task), the numbers may sum to > 1.0.
